byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and PAULINA VILLEGAS

abstract: Lynchings and vigilante justice are on rise in Mexico as country wearies of rampant crime and government corruption and indifference; current mob violence, springing from sense of impotence and sometimes targeting innocent victims, continues and escalates disturbing longtime trend.
lead_paragraph: The actions are born of a sense of hopelessness and impotence in the country, where 98 percent of murders go unsolved and many crimes are not even reported.

headline.main: As Frustrations With Mexico’s Government Rise, So Do Lynchings
headline.print_headline: As Mexican Frustrations Rise, So Does Number of Lynchings

snippet: The actions are born of a sense of hopelessness and impotence in the country, where 98 percent of murders go unsolved and many crimes are not even reported.
